title: First Father-Son Fight Extended Sequence (Invincible #11-13)

comic_source.artist: Ryan Ottley (primary artist), Cory Walker (co-creator/character designs)

summary: Following the massacre of the Guardians of the Globe, Omni-Man finally reveals his true Viltrumite heritage to his son Mark. What begins as an uncomfortable conversation explodes into the most brutal father-son battle in comic book history. Across three issues, Nolan beats Mark mercilessly through city streets, subway tunnels, and past innocent civilians — including the infamous train scene where their bodies split a train car in half. The fight is one-sided devastation, with every punch carrying the weight of imperial duty against fatherly hesitation. In the end, Nolan leaves his son broken but alive — unable to kill the only thing he truly loved on Earth. Mark is left floating in the vacuum of space, watching his father abandon everything.

scenes.narration: On a Chicago rooftop, the world's greatest superhero looks at his son... and tells him the truth. Earth was never meant to be saved. It was meant to be conquered.

scenes.visual_description: Omni-Man and Invincible stand on a city rooftop at dusk. Nolan's cape flows in the wind as he confronts Mark with a cold, unreadable expression. City skyline in background.

scenes.narration: Mark refuses. And in that moment... the father becomes the enemy. The first punch lands like a meteor impact. This isn't a fight. This is an execution.

scenes.narration: They crash through Chicago. Through buildings. Through streets. Mark fights back with everything he has — desperation, rage, the confusion of a son who suddenly realizes he never knew his father at all.

scenes.narration: Every punch is devastating. Mark is outmatched in every way — strength, speed, experience. His father has been fighting wars for thousands of years. Mark has been a hero for months.

scenes.narration: They plunge into the subway. Commuters scream. There's no time to run. In the space of seconds, everything Mark swore to protect becomes collateral damage in his father's lesson.

scenes.narration: Then comes the moment that breaks everything. A speeding train. Nolan doesn't stop. He uses Mark's body as a weapon... and splits the train in half. The passengers never had a chance.

scenes.narration: Back above ground, the beating continues. Nolan lectures his son between punches. Viltrum doesn't leave room for sentiment. It doesn't leave room for love. There is only duty.

scenes.narration: Mark is broken. His body refuses to respond. Nolan hovers above him, his son's life in his hands. The Viltrumite Empire demands execution. The father hesitates.

scenes.narration: Nolan looks at his son... and sees something he can't destroy. The one thing the Viltrumite Empire never accounted for. A father who actually loves his child.
